page.title: 06ARTS AND CRAFTS IN BERROW
page.content: The area consists of a hillside with cottages and larger houses, the land falling away from the crest of Chase End Hill towards the Severn Valley. There is no centre of population and so the{crafts}and{hobbies}are those which are completed in homes or in loosely formed groups covering several interests. The most popular{hobby}is {landscape painting,}closely followed by{spinning and weaving}the local fleece. This is dyed with vegetable dyes found in the fields and hedgerows. This yarn is knitted or crocheted into garments or woven into rugs. A number of local people embroider on fine linen. We have an expert lacemaker who has been pursuing her craft for many years, and a lady who presses local flowers and leaves and makes them into attractive pictures, which she sells.
